instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2015 test enclosure
threads.message:
Hi, First I wanna apologize as I don’t know if this is the right place for this question. I have a few boards <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from ranging from 2013-2015 I’m looking to buy a test enclosure I found a few 2013 and A few 2015 Enclosures 
Both seem pretty similar. Are all these board compatible with either of these enclosures ?
By enclosures I mean the case with screen and palest battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2015 test enclosure
threads.message: You can interchange 3437 and 00165 boards, in the same test enclosure.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2015 test enclosure
threads.message: Thank you for clearing that up :)
